entries.title: Voice recording for statuses is coming to WhatsApp but there are limitations
entries.description: Besides voice status updates, WhatsApp is testing faster chat transfer for Android, and new camera modes for iOS.

entries.title: Thousands of Sophos servers are vulnerable to this dangerous exploit
entries.description: A patch has been available for months now but many IT managers haven't applied it yet.

entries.title: HomePod Mini update will soon unlock its secret smart home powers
entries.description: A HomePod Mini software update will soon unlock its temperature and humidity sensors for some fun smart home automations.

entries.title: Watch and freak out a little as Boston Dynamics puts Atlas robot to work
entries.description: The latest Boston Dynamics Atlas robot demonstration is also its first real-world work scenario

entries.title: Denon’s 8K-ready receiver is the perfect match for your PS5
entries.description: AV receivers in recent years have shipped minus up-to-date video features, but Denon’s new model arrives fully loaded

entries.title: Many businesses are set to spend big to raise their security game
entries.description: Cybersecurity and data handling are in need of a boost, Veeam survey finds.

entries.title: This feature you've never heard of might be letting anyone you know snoop on your iPhone
entries.description: After removing the option in an iPhone’s settings to see if an (admittedly useful) backup feature is enabled, users may have no idea they’re being spied on.

entries.title: This AI writing app now fixes your lousy spelling mistakes
entries.description: DeepL’s Grammarly-style writing tool will use AI to fix spelling, grammar, and more.

entries.title: IBM says quantum computing could be a big risk to the future of encryption
entries.description: IBM says that quantum computing can crack cryptography keys, so it’s preparing a quantum-safe solution.

entries.title: This dangerous malvertising campaign mimicks popular software to steal victim info
entries.description: Audacity, GIMP, and many other popular software are being impersonated to deliver Vidar, IcedID, and other malware.

entries.title: This long-delayed shooter finally has PS5 and Xbox Series X performance confirmed
entries.description: Atomic Heart’s performance modes on PS5 and Xbox Series X have been detailed by developer Mundfish.

entries.title: More on new MacBooks: Shaky M2 Pro rumors dispelled, but Wi-Fi 6E support has a catch
entries.description: If you thought the M2 Pro might use faster RAM as a previous rumor claimed, prepare for disappointment.

entries.title: GitHub Codespaces can be hijacked to send out malware
entries.description: GitHub Codespaces hacked to host malware and deliver it to the public via URL.

entries.title: You can now stop your PS5's mega beep from waking up the neighborhood
entries.description: PS5 gamers have found a way to stop the console from making its loud beep on start-up through clever usage of the PS app.

entries.title: Zack Snyder's Rebel Moon leads exciting 2023 Netflix movie slate
entries.description: Netflix has announced a batch of release dates for its 2023 slate of films, including Rebel Moon and Extraction 2.

entries.title: Bitwarden snaps up Passwordless.dev
entries.description: Two open source platforms merge for the future of online security.

entries.title: Face a mob for making too few bowler hats in this PS5 and Xbox Series X game
entries.description: Anno 1800 is coming to Xbox Series X and PS5, challenging you to meet the needs of a demanding populace.

entries.title: Apple reveals new HomePod 2 wireless speaker built for Dolby Atmos
entries.description: Developing: surprise speaker now packs Spatial Audio support

entries.title: There's a game in the PlayStation sale that will tear your friendship group apart
entries.description: Get some delicious games for a bargain in the PlayStation store.

entries.title: Gmail reportedly cleared of political bias following GOP filtering accusations
entries.description: The FEC has closed the case against Gmail’s reported political campaign filtering, but a lawsuit remains pending.

entries.title: Nissan confirms data breach, but says it isn't to blame
entries.description: Data breach affecting almost 18,000 customers reportedly caused by a misconfigured database.

entries.title: Final Fantasy 7 mod adds something the RPG's been missing for decades
entries.description: A glorious new mod for the PC version of the original Final Fantasy 7 adds voice acting to the entire game.

entries.title: Google’s rumored AirTag rival could be an Android moment for Bluetooth trackers
entries.description: If Google does make its rumored AirTag rival, location trackers could become an essential accessory for the absent-minded.

entries.title: On Amazon's secret service: Prime Video loses Bond movies to the new MGM+
entries.description: Amazon's new service in the US replaces the Epix streaming service, and it means we probably shouldn't expect James Bond back on Prime soon…

entries.title: Twitter's sudden ban on third-party apps is baffling as it is stupid
entries.description: Twitter's dev team is setting a dangerous precedent of miscommunication and complacency with one tweet.

entries.title: Nvidia RTX 4070 leak suggests GPU could be out soon
entries.description: Thinking of buying an Nvidia RTX 4070 Ti? Well, bear in mind that the RTX 4070 may arrive soon.

entries.title: Microsoft could be the next tech giant to announce massive layoffs
entries.description: More tech jobs are at risk as rumors spread that Microsoft is set to cut 11,000 jobs.

entries.title: Apple replacing its AR glasses with a cheaper VR headset is the right call
entries.description: Apple's AR Glasses have been put on hold and it'll launch a second cheaper VR headset instead, and we're happy about it.

entries.title: The next iOS 16 update will fix two annoying iPhone 14 issues
entries.description: Apple's next iOS 16 update is expected to patch two frustrating iPhone issues.

entries.title: Dell's new PowerEdge services promise latest Intel chips, top-end AI power
entries.description: Dell’s latest-generation servers use Intel’s 4th Gen Xeon Scalable processors for better AI and efficiency.

entries.title: Samsung Galaxy S23 series specs and pricing detailed in extensive new leaks
entries.description: The Samsung Galaxy S23 series could cost more than the S22 line, despite reportedly only offering small upgrades.

entries.title: John Wick director is making a Rainbow Six movie – and I couldn't be more excited
entries.description: A Rainbow Six movie is finally in development – and it won't be releasing direct to streaming.

entries.title: How we test, review and rate on TechRadar Pro: Office Chairs
entries.description: Independent, authoritative testing - guaranteed.

entries.title: Fake DHL emails allow hackers to breach Microsoft 365 accounts
entries.description: Phishing emails impersonating DHL aim to trick victims into handing over Microsoft 365 credentials.

entries.title: Naturally, a Porsche-inspired gaming chair would be priced like a sports car
entries.description: The Porsche Gaming Chair supports your lower back yet it adds a big burden to your wallet with its high price tag.

entries.title: I can’t believe this huge storage company wants to mix tape and hard drive technology
entries.description: Integrating the head into the media cartridge sounds like a no-brainer, so why has it taken so long?
